content:
The Nathan Langsam Family


http://familytreemaker.genealogy.com/users/r/o/s/Joel-M-Rosenwasser/GENE4-0003.html 

Joel Mark Rosenwasser
3208 Burn Brae Drive
Dresher, PA 19025
United States 
(215) 830-3030
                                                  lasermen@aol.com


7. MYRA LEAH3 CROOG (EVELYN DIANA2 AARONSON, SAMUEL DAVID1) was born September 1, 1934 in New Haven, CT. She married EUGENE ALFRED LANGSAM September 23, 1962.
     
Children of MYRA CROOG and EUGENE LANGSAM are:
  i.   NATHANIA ANN4 LANGSAM, b. July 19, 1963, Far Rockaway, New York.
  ii.   JENNY SUSAN LANGSAM, b. July 12, 1965, Far Rockaway, New York; m. DAVID JAY KOPELMAN, March 23, 1996. 


From: moishe@langsam.com (moishe@langsam.com)
Subject: The Langsam Family
Date: Wed, 12 Jan 2000 23:36:58 -0500


Hi,
I am an amateur genealogist researching my family history. Pesach Langsam
(1748 - 1820) had several children, the oldest one never having adopted the
surname LANGSAM (but rather Miller, from whom I descend).
Would you perhaps be interested in exploring a possible connection to the
original Pesach Langsam? I have a website with a fair amount of detail on
his descendents. It is at
www.langsam.com


I look forward to your response.
-Moishe Miller
moishe@langsam.com
____________________________________________________________
From: "Nathania Langsam"  
To: moishe@langsam.com 
Subject: Re: The Langsam Family 
Date: Thu, 13 Jan 2000 10:28:57 EST 


I have looked at your site and I don't believe that my family descends from yours.
____________________________________________________________
Date: Thu, 29 Jun 2000 01:27:12 -0700
To: "Nathania Langsam" 
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: Re: The Langsam Family

Hi,
Is this you?
7. MYRA LEAH3 CROOG (EVELYN DIANA2 AARONSON, SAMUEL DAVID1) was born September 1,
1934 in New Haven, CT. She married EUGENE ALFRED LANGSAM September 23, 1962.

Children of MYRA CROOG and EUGENE LANGSAM are:

             i.

                NATHANIA ANN4 LANGSAM, b. July 19, 1963, Far Rockaway, New
                York.

            ii.

                JENNY SUSAN LANGSAM, b. July 12, 1965, Far Rockaway, New York;
                m. DAVID JAY KOPELMAN, March 23, 1996.
____________________________________________________________

Date: Sat, 18 Mar 2000 22:41:54 -0500
To: lasermen@aol.com
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: Langsam Family

Hi,
Saw your site through Family Tree Maker. I am working on a LANGSAM family tree 
and was wondering if you could supply any more information. In your tree there is:
7. MYRA LEAH3 CROOG (EVELYN DIANA2 AARONSON, SAMUEL DAVID1) was born September 1,
1934 in New Haven, CT. She married EUGENE ALFRED LANGSAM September 23, 1962. 
      
Children of MYRA CROOG and EUGENE LANGSAM are: 
 
             i.
               
                NATHANIA ANN4 LANGSAM, b. July 19, 1963, Far Rockaway, New
                York.
 
            ii.
               
                JENNY SUSAN LANGSAM, b. July 12, 1965, Far Rockaway, New York;
                m. DAVID JAY KOPELMAN, March 23, 1996.


Do you know of any more detail on the Langsam side of that branch? 

Thanks!
-Moishe Miller
moishe@langsam.com
www.langsam.com
____________________________________________________________

At 03:48 PM 3/29/00 -0500, Lasermen@aol.com wrote:
I forwarded your e-mail to the appropriate members of the family.  The 
Langsams are on my wife's side of the family and although I know them, I 
don't know much more than what was listed in the family tree.  I hope their 
communication with you helps!

Sincerely

Joel Rosenwasser 
____________________________________________________________

Date: Mon, 29 May 2000 12:21:30 -0700
To: "Nathania Langsam" 
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: Re: The Langsam Family

Hi,
I have more data than what is posted and was wondering if you might be 
able to just outline the oldest known LANGSAM ancestry that you are aware 
of. The bulk of Pesach Langsam's offspring lived in Galicia and Slovakia, 
although by 1900 there were descendants living on six continents.
Thanks!
-Moishe Miller
moishe@langsam.com
www.langsam.com
____________________________________________________________
From: "Nathania Langsam"  
To: moishe@langsam.com 
Subject: Re: The Langsam Family 
Date: Mon, 29 May 2000 09:37  EST 

I dont have any info.
____________________________________________________________
Date: Thu, 12 Jul 2001 23:05:04 -0400
To: Lasermen@aol.com
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: Fwd: Re: Langsam Family

Dear Joel,
I was hoping you might be able to elaborate even a little on the LANGSAM part 
even a little. What I have is 

7. MYRA LEAH CROOG (EVELYN DIANA AARONSON, SAMUEL DAVID) was born September 1, 
1934 in New Haven, CT. She married EUGENE ALFRED LANGSAM September 23, 1962.
Children of MYRA CROOG and EUGENE LANGSAM are:
i.
NATHANIA ANN4 LANGSAM, b. July 19, 1963, Far Rockaway, New 
York.
ii.
JENNY SUSAN LANGSAM, b. July 12, 1965, Far Rockaway, New York; 
m. DAVID JAY KOPELMAN, March 23, 1996.


Do you know of any more detail on the Langsam side of that branch?

Thanks! 
-Moishe Miller 
moishe@langsam.com 

www.langsam.com
____________________________________________________________
Date: Sun, 22 Jul 2001 20:51:17 -0400 
From: myra  
Subject: note to JoelRosenwasser re langsam family 
To: moishe@langsam.com 
X-Mailer: Mozilla 4.75 [en] (Win95; U) 
X-Accept-Language: en 


Myra Langsam was born Myra Leah Croog to Evelyn Diana Aaronson and Abner
A. Croog (not Samuel Aaronson). Nathania's middle name is Ann (not
Anna). Eugene's parents were Nathan Langsam (d. March l963) at the age
of 65. Mother of Eugene was Bessie Langsam nee Laks9 (d. July 1983). Any
other info requested must be more specific
____________________________________________________________
Date: Fri, 20 Jul 2001 02:55:15 -0400
To: myra <myra24@optonline.net>
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: Re: note to JoelRosenwasser re langsam family

Hi,
Thanks so much for the reply. I am researching the LANGSAM family genealogy and have a 
website devoted to this at www.langsam.com

Can you tell me who Nathans' parents were? 
Where were they from ?
Did Nathan have any siblings?

Thanks so much! 
-Moishe Miller
moishe@langsam.com
____________________________________________________________
Date: Mon, 23 Jul 2001 19:11:43 -0400 
From: myra <myra24@optonline.net> 
Subject: Re: note to JoelRosenwasser re langsam family 
To: "moishe@langsam.com"  
X-Mailer: Mozilla 4.75 [en] (Win95; U) 
X-Accept-Language: en 


Hi! The only question I can respond to is the one about Nat's brothers.  I know
he did have one, two or three. But as my husband passed away I really have
little recall on this matter.  I do know that one of his brothers was Abraham
who I think was a doctor at the Veteran's Hospital in Coney Island years ago.
He also had two nephews who I remember, Nat and Ben who were brothers and lived
in Brooklyn.  One I know was a lawyer, the other I can't recall.  All I do
remember about them is that they were very nice guys.  Hope this helps a
little.
Myra
_______________________________________________________________________
Date: Mon, 23 Jul 2001 23:08:29 -0400
To: myra 
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: Saul Langsam Family

Hi,
Thanks so much. This was just enough detail for me to place the family. You can view the specific page in my site that deals with this general branch, starting with Saul Langsam, circa 1830's. 

http://www.ics.uci.edu/~dan/genealogy/Miller/langsam/saul.htm

or a more general reference at

http://www.ics.uci.edu/~dan/genealogy/Miller/langsam/langsam.htm

That being said, perhaps I can trouble you for two more pieces of information:
 How many children did Nat have?
 Would any of them (or their offspring) be interested in the family genealogy?

Thanks again so much for your help and information!

-Moishe Miller
moishe@langsam.com

www.langsam.com

_______________________________________________________________________
Date: Tue, 24 Jul 2001 18:13:49 -0400 
From: myra <myra24@optonline.net> 
Subject: Re: Saul Langsam Family 
To: "moishe@langsam.com"  
X-Mailer: Mozilla 4.75 [en] (Win95; U) 
X-Accept-Language: en 


Hi! Sorry, but that's about all of the info I have on the family.  Wish I could
answer the questions you now have, but al least I'm glad that I could help you out
a bit.
Myra


I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.

Moishe Miller
moishe@langsam.com

My home address is
           1374 East 28th Street
           Brooklyn NY 11210-5311
           USA

Last updated 11/14/00
